00020 #define ARROW_BTSP_SOLVE_PLAN_BASIC 1

00024 /**
00025  *  @brief  BTSP result
00026  */
00027 typedef struct arrow_btsp_result
00028 {
00029     int found_tour;         /**< true if a tour was found, false otherwise */
00030     int obj_value;          /**< objective value (largest cost in tour) */
00031     double tour_length;     /**< length of the tour found */
00032     int *tour;              /**< tour that was found in node-node format */
00033     int optimal;            /**< indicates if the solution is optimal */
00034     int bin_search_steps;   /**< number of steps in binary search */
00035     int solver_attempts[ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT]; /**< calls to solver */
00036     double solver_time[ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT];  /**< total time for solver */
00037     double total_time;      /**< total time */
00038 } arrow_btsp_result;
00039 
00040 /**
00041  *  @brief  BTSP Cost matrix function definition
00042  */
00043 typedef struct arrow_btsp_fun
00044 {
00045     void *data;             /**< data required by function */
00046     int shallow;            /**< indicates use of shallow copy of data */
00047 
00048     /**
00049      *  @brief  Retrieves cost between nodes i and j from the function.
00050      *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00051      *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00052      *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00053      *  @param  i [in] id of start node
00054      *  @param  j [in] id of end node
00055      *  @return cost between node i and node j
00056      */
00057     int 
00058     (*get_cost)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00059                 int delta, int i, int j);
00060                 
00061     /**
00062      *  @brief  Initializes the function structure for a new problem
00063      *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00064      */
00065     int 
00066     (*initialize)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00067     
00068     /**
00069      *  @brief  Destructs the function structure
00070      *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00071      */
00072     void 
00073     (*destruct)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00074     
00075     /**
00076      *  @brief  Determines if the given tour is feasible or not.
00077      *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00078      *  @param  problem [in] the problem to check against
00079      *  @param  delta [in] the delta parameter
00080      *  @param  tour_length [in] the length of the given tour
00081      *  @param  tour [in] the tour in node-node format
00082      *  @return ARROW_TRUE if the tour is feasible, ARROW_FALSE if not
00083      */
00084     int
00085     (*feasible)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00086                 int delta, double tour_length, int *tour);
00087 } arrow_btsp_fun;
00088 
00089 /**
00090  *  @brief  BTSP feasibility solve step plan
00091  */
00092 typedef struct arrow_btsp_solve_plan
00093 {
00094     int tsp_solver;                 /**< TSP solver to use */
00095     void *tsp_params;               /**< TSP params to use */
00096     arrow_btsp_fun fun;             /**< the cost matrix function to apply */
00097     int attempts;                   /**< number of attempts to perform */
00098 } arrow_btsp_solve_plan;
00099 
00100 /**
00101  *  @brief  BTSP algorithm parameters
00102  */
00103 typedef struct arrow_btsp_params
00104 {
00105     int confirm_sol;                /**< confirm sol. with exact solver? */
00106     int supress_ebst;               /**< supress EBST-heuristic? */
00107     int find_short_tour;            /**< find short BSTP tour? */
00108     int lower_bound;                /**< initial lower bound */
00109     int upper_bound;                /**< initial upper bound */
00110     int num_steps;                  /**< the number of solve plan steps */
00111     arrow_btsp_solve_plan *steps;   /**< solve plan steps */
00112     arrow_btsp_solve_plan confirm_plan;   /**< confirm plan */
00113 } arrow_btsp_params;

00116 /****************************************************************************
00117  *  btsp.c
00118  ****************************************************************************/
00119 /**
00120  *  @brief  Solves TSP with Concorde's exact solver.
00121  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00122  *  @param  info [in] extra problem info
00123  *  @param  params [in] parameters for solver (can be NULL)
00124  *  @param  result [out] BTSP solution
00125  */
00126 int
00127 arrow_btsp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info,
00128                  arrow_btsp_params *params, arrow_btsp_result *result);

00132  *  fun.c
00133  ****************************************************************************/
00134 /**
00135  *  @brief  Applies the given function to the given problem to create a new
00136  *          problem.
00137  *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00138  *  @param  old_problem [in] existing problem
00139  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00140  *  @param  new_problem [out] new problem to create
00141  */
00142 int
00143 arrow_btsp_fun_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00144                      int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem);

00177 /**
00178  *  @brief  Controlled Type I Shake.
00179  *  @param  shallow [in] ARROW_TRUE for shallow copy, ARROW_FALSE for deep
00180  *  @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00181  *  @param  random_min [in] minimum random value to generate
00182  *  @param  random_max [in] maximum random value to generate
00183  *  @param  info [in] information about the original problem
00184  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00185  */

00187 arrow_btsp_fun_sbtsp_shake_1(int shallow, int infinity,
00188                              int random_min, int random_max,
00189                              arrow_problem_info *info, arrow_btsp_fun *fun);

00191 /****************************************************************************
00192  *  fun_cbtsp.c
00193  ****************************************************************************/
00194 /**
00195  *  @brief  Constrained BTSP to TSP function
00196  *  @param  shallow [in] ARROW_TRUE for shallow copy, ARROW_FALSE for deep
00197  *  @param  feasible_length [in] length of feasible tour
00198  *  @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00199  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00200  */
00201 int
00202 arrow_btsp_fun_cbtsp_basic(int shallow, double feasible_length, int infinity,
00203                            arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00204 
00205 /**
00206  *  @brief  Constrained "Shake" BTSP to TSP function

00208  *  @param  feasible_length [in] length of feasible tour
00209  *  @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00210  *  @param  random_min [in] minimum random value to generate

00213  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00214  */
